title: The Curious Dragon
content: In a mystical [forest|forests], there lived a [dragon|dragons] named Draco. Every day, Draco collected shiny [gems|gem] and rare [herbs|herb]. One day, he met a wise [owl|owls] who told him about a hidden [treasure|treasures]. Together, they embarked on an exciting [adventure|adventures], exploring ancient [ruin-ruins] and enchanted [cave-caves]. They faced many [challenges|challenge] but overcame each [one|ones] with bravery. At the end of their [journey-journeys], they found a magical [artifact|artifacts] that granted [wish-wishes]. Draco made a [wish|wishes] for peace in the [kingdom-kingdoms]. Returning home, he shared his [story-stories] with his [friends|friend], inspiring them to seek their own [adventure-adventures]. Draco realized that true [treasures|treasure] are the [memory-memories] we make and the [friendship-friendships] we share.

# ğŸ² è¦ªæ„›çš„å°å†’éšªè€…å€‘ï¼Œè®“æˆ‘å€‘ä¸€èµ·çœ‹çœ‹åè©çš„ç”¨æ³•å§ï¼

- **[forest|forests]**ï¼šå‰é¢æœ‰ "a"ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥åªèƒ½ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **forest**ã€‚
- **[dragon|dragons]**ï¼šå› ç‚ºåªæœ‰ä¸€æ¢é¾ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **dragon**ã€‚
- **[gems|gem]** å’Œ **[herbs|herb]**ï¼šä»–æ”¶é›†äº†è¨±å¤šå¯¶çŸ³å’Œè‰è—¥ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **gems** å’Œ **herbs**ã€‚
- **[owl|owls]**ï¼šä»–é‡åˆ°ä¸€éš»è²“é ­é·¹ï¼Œ"a" è¡¨ç¤ºå–®æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ **owl**ã€‚
- **[treasure|treasures]**ï¼š"a hidden" å¾Œé¢åªèƒ½æ¥å–®æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ **treasure**ã€‚
- **[adventure|adventures]**ï¼š"an" å¾Œé¢æ¥å–®æ•¸ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ **adventure**ã€‚
- **[ruin-ruins]** å’Œ **[cave-caves]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ä»¥ï¼Œå› ç‚ºæ¢ç´¢ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹éºè·¡å’Œæ´ç©´éƒ½åˆç†ã€‚
- **[challenges|challenge]**ï¼š"many" è¡¨ç¤ºå¤šæ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **challenges**ã€‚
- **[one|ones]**ï¼š"each" å¾Œé¢æ¥å–®æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ **one**ã€‚
- **[journey-journeys]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ä»¥ï¼Œä»–å€‘å¯èƒ½æœ‰ä¸€æ®µæˆ–å¤šæ®µæ—…ç¨‹ã€‚
- **[artifact|artifacts]**ï¼š"a" è¡¨ç¤ºå–®æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ **artifact**ã€‚
- **[wish-wishes]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½è¡Œï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯è¨±ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹é¡˜æœ›ã€‚
- **[kingdom-kingdoms]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ï¼Œçœ‹ä»–å¸Œæœ›å’Œå¹³çš„æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹ç‹åœ‹ã€‚
- **[story-stories]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½è¡Œï¼Œä»–å¯èƒ½åˆ†äº«ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹æ•…äº‹ã€‚
- **[friends|friend]**ï¼šå¾Œæ–‡æåˆ° "them"ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **friends**ã€‚
- **[adventure-adventures]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ï¼Œå°‹æ‰¾ä¸€å ´æˆ–å¤šå ´å†’éšªã€‚
- **[treasures|treasure]**ï¼š"are" è¡¨ç¤ºè¤‡æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **treasures**ã€‚
- **[memory-memories]** å’Œ **[friendship-friendships]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ï¼Œçœ‹æ˜¯å¼·èª¿å–®ä¸€é‚„æ˜¯å¤šå€‹å›æ†¶å’Œå‹èª¼ã€‚

explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ² Dear little adventurers, let's explore the nouns!

- **[forest|forests]**: With "a" before, only singular **forest** is correct.
- **[dragon|dragons]**: Only one dragon, so we use singular **dragon**.
- **[gems|gem]** and **[herbs|herb]**: He collected many, so plural **gems** and **herbs** are correct.
- **[owl|owls]**: "a" indicates singular, so we use **owl**.
- **[treasure|treasures]**: "a hidden" requires singular **treasure**.
- **[adventure|adventures]**: "an" before it means singular **adventure**.
- **[ruin-ruins]** and **[cave-caves]**: Both forms are acceptable; they could explore one or many.
- **[challenges|challenge]**: "many" needs plural **challenges**.
- **[one|ones]**: "each" is followed by singular **one**.
- **[journey-journeys]**: Both forms work; they might have had one or multiple journeys.
- **[artifact|artifacts]**: "a" requires singular **artifact**.
- **[wish-wishes]**: Both forms are acceptable; the artifact could grant one or many wishes.
- **[kingdom-kingdoms]**: Both forms work, depending on whether peace is wished for one or multiple kingdoms.
- **[story-stories]**: Both forms are correct; he may have shared one or many stories.
- **[friends|friend]**: Since it says "them," plural **friends** is correct.
- **[adventure-adventures]**: Both forms are acceptable; they could seek one or multiple adventures.
- **[treasures|treasure]**: "are" indicates plural, so **treasures** is correct.
- **[memory-memories]** and **[friendship-friendships]**: Both forms work, depending on emphasis on singular or multiple memories and friendships.

Great story, isn't it? âœ¨

title: The Mischievous Goblin
content: In a hidden [village|villages], there lived a [goblin|goblins] named Gizmo. Gizmo loved playing pranks on his [neighbors|neighbor], hiding their [shoes|shoe] and tickling their [noses|nose]. One day, he found a mysterious [map|maps] leading to secret [tunnel-tunnels]. Gathering his courage, he ventured into the [tunnel-tunnels] and discovered forgotten [toys-toy] and delicious [candies-candy]. He decided to share these [treasures-treasure] with his [community|communities], making everyone smile. From then on, Gizmo became the village's favorite [goblin|goblins], known for his generous [heart|hearts].

- **[neighbors|neighbor]**ï¼šä»–æ‰å¼„è¨±å¤šé„°å±…ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **neighbors**ã€‚
- **[shoes|shoe]** å’Œ **[noses|nose]**ï¼šå› ç‚ºæœ‰å¤šå€‹é„°å±…ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **shoes** å’Œ **noses**ã€‚
- **[map|maps]**ï¼šä»–æ‰¾åˆ°äº†ä¸€å¼µåœ°åœ–ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **map**ã€‚
- **[tunnel-tunnels]**ï¼šä»–å¯èƒ½é€²å…¥äº†ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹éš§é“ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[toys-toy]** å’Œ **[candies-candy]**ï¼šä»–ç™¼ç¾äº†ç©å…·å’Œç³–æœï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯å–®å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½è¡Œã€‚
- **[treasures-treasure]**ï¼šä»–åˆ†äº«äº†å¯¶è—ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[community|communities]**ï¼šä»–æ‰€åœ¨çš„ç¤¾å€æ˜¯å–®ä¸€çš„ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **community**ã€‚

explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸ Hey pals, let's check out the nouns!

- **[village|villages]**: Only one village, so singular **village** is correct.
- **[goblin|goblins]**: Gizmo is one goblin, so we use singular **goblin**.

title: The Brave Unicorn
content: In the enchanted [meadow|meadows], a [unicorn|unicorns] named Luna danced under the [moon|moons]. She had a shimmering [horn|horns] and a sparkling [mane|manes]. One night, she heard a cry for help from a lost [fairy|fairies]. Luna galloped through the [forest-forests] to rescue the [fairy|fairies]. Together, they faced dark [shadows|shadow] and tricky [puzzles|puzzle]. Luna's bravery saved the day, and they became best [friends-friend]. The [fairy|fairies] gifted her magical [flowers-flower] that bloomed every [night-nights].

- **[unicorn|unicorns]**ï¼šLuna æ˜¯ä¸€éš»ç¨è§’ç¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **unicorn**ã€‚
- **[moon|moons]**ï¼šå¤©ä¸Šåªæœ‰ä¸€å€‹æœˆäº®ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **moon**ã€‚
- **[horn|horns]** å’Œ **[mane|manes]**ï¼šå¥¹æœ‰ä¸€æ”¯è§’å’Œä¸€é ­é¬ƒæ¯›ï¼Œå–®æ•¸å½¢å¼ã€‚

- **[forest-forests]**ï¼šå¥¹ç©¿è¶Šæ£®æ—ï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯ä¸€ç‰‡æˆ–å¤šç‰‡ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[shadows|shadow]** å’Œ **[puzzles|puzzle]**ï¼šå¥¹å€‘é¢å°å¤šå€‹é™°å½±å’Œè¬é¡Œï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **shadows** å’Œ **puzzles**ã€‚
- **[friends-friend]**ï¼šå¥¹å€‘æˆç‚ºæœ€å¥½çš„æœ‹å‹ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[flowers-flower]**ï¼šä»™å¥³é€çµ¦å¥¹èŠ±æœµï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯ä¸€æœµæˆ–å¤šæœµï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½è¡Œã€‚
- **[night-nights]**ï¼šèŠ±æœµæ¯æ™šç¶»æ”¾ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚

ç¥å¥‡å§ï¼ŸğŸŒ™
explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ¦„ Hello little dreamers, let's explore nouns together!

- **[meadow|meadows]**: Only one meadow, so singular **meadow**.
- **[unicorn|unicorns]**: Luna is one unicorn, so singular **unicorn**.
- **[moon|moons]**: Only one moon, so singular **moon**.
- **[horn|horns]** and **[mane|manes]**: She has one horn and one mane, so singular forms.

title: The Wise Troll
content: Under the ancient [bridge|bridges], there lived a wise [troll|trolls] named Tobias. Unlike other [trolls|troll], Tobias loved reading old [books|book] and solving complex [riddles|riddle]. Travelers would come to him seeking [advice|advices] and challenging him with [questions-question]. Tobias enjoyed sharing his [knowledge|knowledges] and making new [friends-friend]. One day, he taught a young [knight|knights] the secret of true [courage|courages]. The [knight|knights] thanked him and promised to spread kindness throughout the [land-lands].

# ğŸ§â€â™‚ï¸ è¦ªæ„›çš„å°å­¸è€…å€‘ï¼Œä¾†çœ‹çœ‹åè©çš„é­”åŠ›ï¼

- **[bridge|bridges]**ï¼šåªæœ‰ä¸€åº§æ©‹ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **bridge**ã€‚
- **[troll|trolls]**ï¼šTobias æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹å·¨é­”ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **troll**ã€‚
- **[trolls|troll]**ï¼šå…¶ä»–å·¨é­”ï¼Œè¤‡æ•¸ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨ **trolls**ã€‚
- **[books|book]** å’Œ **[riddles|riddle]**ï¼šä»–é–±è®€å’Œè§£ç­”å¾ˆå¤šï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **books** å’Œ **riddles**ã€‚
- **[advice|advices]**ï¼š"advice" æ˜¯ä¸å¯æ•¸åè©ï¼Œæ²’æœ‰è¤‡æ•¸å½¢å¼ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ã€‚
- **[questions-question]**ï¼šå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ï¼Œæ—…å®¢å¯èƒ½å•ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹å•é¡Œã€‚
- **[knowledge|knowledges]**ï¼š"knowledge" æ˜¯ä¸å¯æ•¸åè©ï¼Œæ²’æœ‰è¤‡æ•¸å½¢å¼ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ã€‚
- **[friends-friend]**ï¼šä»–çµäº¤æ–°æœ‹å‹ï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯å–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[knight|knights]**ï¼šä»–æ•™å°äº†ä¸€ä½é¨å£«ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **knight**ã€‚
- **[courage|courages]**ï¼š"courage" æ˜¯ä¸å¯æ•¸åè©ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ã€‚
- **[land-lands]**ï¼šä»–å€‘è¦å‚³æ’­å–„è‰¯åˆ°ä¸€å€‹æˆ–å¤šå€‹åœŸåœ°ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ã€‚

å²å®³å§ï¼ŸğŸ“–
explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ§â€â™‚ï¸ Greetings, young scholars! Let's see the magic of nouns!

- **[bridge|bridges]**: Only one bridge, so singular **bridge**.
- **[troll|trolls]**: Tobias is one troll, so singular **troll**.
- **[trolls|troll]**: Referring to other trolls, so plural **trolls**.
- **[books|book]** and **[riddles|riddle]**: Plural because he reads and solves many.
- **[advice|advices]**: "advice" is uncountable, so singular form.
- **[questions-question]**: Both forms are acceptable; travelers may ask one or many questions.
- **[knowledge|knowledges]**: "knowledge" is uncountable, so singular.
- **[friends-friend]**: Both forms work; he makes new friend or friends.
- **[knight|knights]**: He taught one knight, so singular **knight**.
- **[courage|courages]**: "courage" is uncountable, so singular.
- **[land-lands]**: Both forms are acceptable; spreading kindness throughout one or multiple lands.

title: The Playful Fairy
content: In a hidden [grove|groves], a playful [fairy|fairies] named Faye sprinkled magical [dust|dusts] on sleeping [flowers|flower]. The [flowers|flower] would bloom into vibrant [colors-color], delighting the forest [animals|animal]. One day, Faye found a sad [squirrel|squirrels] who lost its [acorns-acorn]. She used her magic to grow new [trees-tree] filled with tasty [nuts-nut]. The [squirrel|squirrels] thanked her with a big [smile-smiles]. Faye felt happy to spread joy and decided to help more [creatures-creature] in need.
explanation-zh-TW:
# ğŸ§šâ€â™€ï¸ å°ç²¾éˆå€‘ï¼Œä¾†çœ‹çœ‹åè©å§ï¼

- **[grove|groves]**ï¼šåªæœ‰ä¸€å€‹æ¨¹å¢ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **grove**ã€‚
- **[fairy|fairies]**ï¼šFaye æ˜¯ä¸€ä½ä»™å¥³ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **fairy**ã€‚
- **[dust|dusts]**ï¼š"dust" æ˜¯ä¸å¯æ•¸åè©ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ã€‚
- **[flowers|flower]**ï¼šå¥¹å°å¤šæœµèŠ±æ’’ä¸‹é­”æ³•ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **flowers**ã€‚
- **[colors-color]**ï¼šèŠ±æœµç¶»æ”¾å‡ºå¤šç¨®è‰²å½©ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[animals|animal]**ï¼šæ£®æ—è£¡çš„å‹•ç‰©å¾ˆå¤šï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨è¤‡æ•¸ **animals**ã€‚
- **[squirrel|squirrels]**ï¼šå¥¹é‡åˆ°äº†ä¸€éš»æ¾é¼ ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç”¨å–®æ•¸ **squirrel**ã€‚
- **[acorns-acorn]**ï¼šæ¾é¼ ä¸Ÿå¤±äº†æ©¡å­ï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ˜¯ä¸€é¡†æˆ–å¤šé¡†ï¼Œå…©ç¨®å½¢å¼éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[trees-tree]** å’Œ **[nuts-nut]**ï¼šå¥¹ç¨®ä¸‹æ–°çš„æ¨¹å’Œå …æœï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½è¡Œã€‚
- **[smile-smiles]**ï¼šæ¾é¼ çµ¦äº†å¥¹ä¸€å€‹å¤§å¤§çš„å¾®ç¬‘ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚
- **[creatures-creature]**ï¼šå¥¹æ±ºå®šå¹«åŠ©æ›´å¤šç”Ÿç‰©ï¼Œå–®æ•¸æˆ–è¤‡æ•¸éƒ½å¯ã€‚

æº«é¦¨å§ï¼ŸğŸŒŸ
explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ§šâ€â™€ï¸ Hey little fairies, let's check out the nouns!

- **[grove|groves]**: Only one grove, so singular **grove**.
- **[fairy|fairies]**: Faye is one fairy, so singular **fairy**.
- **[dust|dusts]**: "dust" is uncountable, so singular.
- **[flowers|flower]**: She sprinkles magic on many, so plural **flowers**.
- **[colors-color]**: Both forms work; flowers bloom into vibrant color or colors.
- **[animals|animal]**: Many animals, so plural **animals**.
- **[squirrel|squirrels]**: She found one squirrel, so singular **squirrel**.
- **[acorns-acorn]**: Both forms acceptable; the squirrel lost one or many acorns.
- **[trees-tree]** and **[nuts-nut]**: Both forms work; she grew one or many.
- **[smile-smiles]**: The squirrel thanked her with a big smile or smiles; both are correct.
- **[creatures-creature]**: Both forms acceptable; she helps one or many creatures.

Heartwarming, isn't it? ğŸŒŸ
